greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, T(n,k) = A000055(n-k) * (A157904 * 0^(n-k))
comment: As a property of eigentriangles, sum of n-th row terms = rightmost term of next row.
formula: Triangle read by rows, T(n,k) = A000055(n-k) * (A157904 * 0^(n-k)). A000055(n-k) = an infinite lower triangular matrix with A000055 in every column: (1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 3, 6, 11, 23,...). (A157904 * 0^(n-k)) = a matrix with A157904 as the diagonal and the rest zeros.
example: First few rows of the triangle =
mathematica: b[n_] := b[n] = If[n <= 1, n, Sum[Sum[d b[d], {d, Divisors[j]}] b[n - j], {j, 1, n - 1}]/(n - 1)];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 21 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ in A000055 and A157904 *)
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Mar 08 2009
